thread.title: Barry McGuigan tips Josh Taylor to shine on professional home debut
thread.title_full: Barry McGuigan tips Josh Taylor to shine on professional home debut

title: Barry McGuigan tips Josh Taylor to shine on professional home debut
text:
Barry McGuigan tips Josh Taylor to shine on professional home debut 15 Oct 2015 12:02:06 
comments 
Barry McGuigan has backed Josh Taylor to become an immediate star as the Commonwealth Games gold medallist makes his home professional debut. 
The 24-year-old Prestonpans fighter - who won gold for Scotland in Glasgow last year - takes on Hungarian Adam Mate at Meadowbank in Edinburgh on Friday night. 
Having made a successful professional debut in Texas, Taylor has been put in with another 24-year-old, but his opponent is far more experienced in the paid ranks. 
Mate has lost five of 22 fights and once fought tough Irishman Stephen Ormond for the WBO European lightweight title in London. 
But McGuigan, Taylor's manager, has no doubt that the Scot has the talent to prove the match-up is no gamble. 
"We rate him that highly that we can put him in with someone who has 17 wins and 10 knockouts," the former world featherweight champion said. 
"This kid is very good but I really believe that Taylor is at that level and can hit the ground running. 
"He is looking sensational in sparring and is definitely already an international class light-welterweight. 
"He punches ridiculously hard and he forces people to make mistakes with his pace. I think he is going to go a long, long way." Related Sport News
